div:
Elrond PERSON
(Sindarin; IPA: "Star-Dome") Half-elven, Lord of Rivendell, was one of the mighty Elf-rulers of old who lived in Middle-earth from the First Age to the beginning of the Fourth Age. He was the father of
Arwen Undomiel PERSON
, lover of
Aragorn II Elessar PERSON
.
Elrond Half-elven PERSON
is the son of
Eärendil and Elwing PERSON
, and a great-grandson of
Lúthien PERSON
. He was born in the refuge of the Havens of Sirion in Beleriand late in the First Age, soon before its sack by
the Sons of Fëanor PERSON
.
Elrond PERSON
and his twin brother
Elros PERSON
were captured and raised by
Maglor PERSON
a Son of Fëanor. Though at first there was no great love between them, eventually
Maglor PERSON
took pity on them and cherished them, and eventually grew to love them.[1] By the end of the First Age and the War of Wrath, the
Sons of Fëanor PERSON
were again working alone, suggesting that by this time
Elrond PERSON
and
Elros PERSON
had left their nominal captivity and traveled to
Lindon PERSON
.
Elrond PERSON
and
Elros PERSON
were given the choice at the end of the First Age to be counted among Men or Elves. Elros chose the Fate of Men and became
Elros Tar-Minyatur PERSON
, the first King of Númenor.
Elrond PERSON
chose to be counted among the Elves,[2] and remained in
Lindon PERSON
as captain and herald of Gil-Galad, the High King of the Ñoldor.[3] In SA 1695,
Elrond PERSON
was sent to Eregion by Gil-galad in an attempt to protect it from the invading forces of
Sauron PERSON
. Unfortunately, Elrond's host was too weak and was unable to hold off
Sauron PERSON
's army. He retreated north with a host of elves out of Eregion including Celeborn and remained ever watchful of
Sauron PERSON
from there. It was during the following two years (SA 1697) that
Elrond PERSON
founded Rivendell at the feet of the Misty Mountains, which survived as one of the last remaining strongholds against
Sauron PERSON
at the end of the Third Age.[4][5] After the combined forces of the elves under Gil-Galad, Cirdan,
Elrond PERSON
and the Men of Númenor defeated
Sauron PERSON
in SA 1701 Elrond remained in Rivendell and hosted the first White Council, attended by
Galadriel PERSON
, at which it was decided that Elrond's home, the Last Homely House, would remain the last stronghold west of the Misty Mountains, and that the Three Rings then held by Gil-Galad and Galadriel would remain hidden. According to one account Gil-Galad at this time gave
Elrond Vilya PERSON
the Blue Ring, though in other accounts Gil-Galad kept both Narya and Vilya until the end of the Second Age. It was also here that
Elrond PERSON
first met
Celebrían PERSON
, the daughter of
Celeborn PERSON
and
Galadriel PERSON
. Near the end of the Second Age,
Elrond PERSON
rode beside Gil-Galad in the Last Alliance of Elves and Men, which set out from Rivendell to Mordor in SA 3431.
Elrond PERSON
was Gil-galad's herald during the war against
Sauron PERSON
. The Alliance, which also included elves from Lorien, men from Arnor and Gondor, and Dwarves led by
Durin PERSON
lV, eventually defeated
Sauron PERSON
's army and laid siege to Barad-dûr for seven years. Eventually, Sauron himself was defeated by
Elendil PERSON
and Gil-galad, allowing
Isildur PERSON
to cut the One Ring from Sauron's finger and claim the Ring for himself. The Last Alliance of Elves and Men took a toll on the forces of both Elves and Men. Gil-Galad,
Elendil PERSON
, and his younger son Anarion were killed in the siege.
Elrond PERSON
and Cirdan only remained as the commanders of the elves, and
Isildur PERSON
as lord of men. Upon discovering that
Isildur PERSON
had claimed the One Ring for himself
Elrond PERSON
urged Isildur to throw the Ring into the fires of Mount Doom, but the seduction of the ring made Isildur refuse. Isildur claimed the Ring as a Weregild for his father and brother, and
Elrond PERSON
(perhaps not fully understanding the nature of the One Ring) acknowledged his claim.
Isildur PERSON
was then named High King of Gondor and Arnor and took his father's throne, while
Elrond PERSON
returned to Rivendell at the end of the war.[4] In the year TA 109,
Elrond PERSON
wedded
Celebrían PERSON
. In the year TA 130, the twins
Elladan PERSON
and
Elrohir PERSON
were born, and in TA 241 a daughter,
Arwen Undómiel PERSON
.
Elrond PERSON
lost
Celebrían PERSON
in TA 2510 when she was waylaid by orcs crossing the Misty Mountains and, unable to recover, took a ship to the Undying Lands.[6][7] In the later years, he was instrumental in harboring the heirs of
Isildur PERSON
while the line lasted, the most famous of these sons of men was Aragorn son of
Arathorn II PERSON
, whom he took in and fostered as his own after his father died in TA 2933.
Elrond PERSON
, foreseeing the boy's difficult future gave him the name Estel, Sindarin for Hope. Aragorn grew up in Imladris unaware of his kingly lineage until
Elrond PERSON
told him when he had reached his manhood.[8] He also was a member of the White Council, which was often held in Rivendell, and was a great friend of
Gandalf the Grey PERSON
. He helped Thorin Oakenshield's expedition to retake the Lonely Mountain by discovering and translating the Moon Writing on Thorin's map.[9] After Frodo's departure from the Shire with the One Ring,
Elrond PERSON
sent out riders to help guide him back to Rivendell. One of these,
Glorfindel PERSON
, successfully found Frodo and helped him reach Rivendell.[10] On October 25, 3018 he held the Council at which it was decided to attempt to destroy the One Ring. He appeared to have selected the members of the Fellowship other than Frodo and Sam.[11] Later,
Elrond PERSON
sent his sons
Elladan PERSON
and
Elrohir PERSON
with the Rangers of the North to Rohan. Through his sons,
Elrond PERSON
advised Aragorn to take the Paths of the Dead.[12]
Elrond PERSON
remained in Rivendell until the destruction of the One Ring and of
Sauron PERSON
, after which he went to Minas Tirith to surrender the Sceptre of Annúminas to King Elessar and give his daughter
Arwen Undómiel PERSON
away to be married.[13] On September 29, 3021,
Elrond PERSON
left Middle-earth to go over the sea with the other Ring-bearers, never to return.[14]
